metadata.title: CVE-2022-24809 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
net-snmp: A malformed OID in a GET-NEXT to the nsVacmAccessTable can causea NULL pointer dereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24809` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.4
libsnmp-perl - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.4
libsnmp35 - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.4
snmp - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.4
snmpd - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.4
snmptrapd - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.4
tkmib - 5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.8+dfsg-2ubuntu2.4').
